head.title: Lure of Country Roads Instead of Shopping

hedline.hl1: Lure of Country Roads Instead of Shopping

abstract.p: Sara Jasper Cook letter on Scotty Dupree's July 2 Soapbox essay holds she is willing to drive a fair distance and suffer narrow aisles and poor lighting rather than see new retail stores built in Westchester County, NY (S)

block.p: 'Tis a pity Scotty Dupree [Soapbox, July 2] turned Hubert Herring's rumination on luxury living in the suburbs into a diatribe against communism. She missed the inadvertent method behind the madness of ''Westchester's retail . . . a cross between the Third World and relics from the 1950's.''

'Tis a pity Scotty Dupree [Soapbox, July 2] turned Hubert Herring's rumination on luxury living in the suburbs into a diatribe against communism. She missed the inadvertent method behind the madness of ''Westchester's retail . . . a cross between the Third World and relics from the 1950's.''

In northern Westchester, traffic and pollution remain relatively minor compared with, say, Greenwich. I, for one, am willing to drive a fair distance every now and then, as well as suffer narrow aisles and poor lighting closer to home, if that's what's necessary to keep 16-wheel delivery behemoths off our narrow, winding country roads. These roads, not shopping, have something to do with why I've chosen to live in northern Westchester for more than 30 years.
